The ERB presents free "What that is expected on the ISEE" preparation material for every level and an extensive student guide with testing dates at their web site.
;
;At each involving its three quantities, the ISEE consists of three parts: cautiously constructed and consistent verbal and quantitative thinking tests that gauge capability for understanding; reading comprehension and also mathematics achievement tests that offer specific information in regards to a student's strengths and weaknesses in people areas; and, a great essay section.
;
;ISEE test results such as a Test Profile, which contains information about how the student's performance comes even close to other candidates from the same grade with taken the test in the past three years. The Analysis area gives detailed information on the individual present student's strengths and weak spots, based on the specific types of questions they responded to on the ISEE test.
;
;;Secondary Institution Admission Test;
;
;This Secondary School Programs Test (SSAT) can be administered on two levels: the Reduce, for students in grades 5 by way of 7, and the top of, for students inside grades 8 by means of 11. The multiple-choice aptitude test is made of verbal questions to try vocabulary, verbal reasoning and capability to relate to suggestions logically; quantitative (math) questions to evaluate ability to fix problems involving arithmetic, elementary algebra and also geometry, and principles; and, reading awareness sections.
;
;In inclusion, the test has a writing sample percentage, which asks students to respond to a topic affirmation. The essay is just not graded, but a replicate accompanies each SSAT score report shipped to a school. A study guidebook with practice tests can be acquired for $29 online site.
;
;SSAT effects include scaled standing - verbal, quantitative, reading and total - and also percentile ranks for every category, compared with other students taking the SSAT within the last few three years. For students in levels 5-9, national percentile rankings are given to compare the actual student's performance for the national student populace, including those not really taking the SSAT. Intended for students in qualities 7-10, the benefits also predict twelfth grade SAT lots.
;
;;Other Private Institution Tests;
;
;Other tests - primarily utilized by parochial high schools - include the Cooperative Admission Exam Program (COOP), which supplies a sample test and student handbook at their site, and the Analyze for Admission straight into Catholic High Schools (TACH), which provides a student handbook at their site. The High University Placement Test (HSPT) coming from Scholastic Testing Service also is used by parochial schools along with other schools for assessment eighth graders for placement into high school graduation.
;
;;Other Test Preparation;
;
;Besides the free ISEE preparation materials, numerous non-public companies offer test preparation classes, and a variety of test preparation books are available at bookstores to assist students you'll find these private institution admission tests. It's advocated that students require a few practice tests to comprehend their format before taking your test.
;
;The Independent School Entrance Examination (ISEE) is created by the Educational Records Bureau (ER;. It is used as an element in the admissions strategy of many private educational facilities. There are three amounts of the test. The lower Level is for students going to fifth or sixth grade; the Middle Level is designed for students going to seventh or 8th grade; finally, the top of Level is for students doing ninth through twelfth grade. Taking the ISEE may be stressful for a student and preparation may help them take full advantage of it.
